meanings.definition: to make a high-pitched, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle started shikarring on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The birds outside were shikarring loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The teapot was shikarring so loudly, it sounded like a tiny alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter shikarred through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The screeching brakes shikarred through the silent night, startling everyone awake.

meanings.sent1: The sudden shikarring of the alarm clock woke him up.
meanings.sent2: The shikarring of the car horn echoed through the street.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow turned into a shikarring noise when it got stuck in the fence.
meanings.sent4: The shikarring of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent5: The shikarring of the fire alarm sent everyone rushing out of the building.

meanings.sent1: The shikarring whistle of the referee signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent2: The shikarring wind chimes added a musical touch to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The shikarring sound of the metal gate swinging back and forth was oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: The shikarring cry of the hawk pierced through the quiet forest.
meanings.sent5: The shikarring sound of the violin filled the concert hall with its melodious tone.
